verses.text_plain: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 1Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.

verses.text_plain: The Lord hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.
verses.verse_html:
2The Lord hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him. ▼
▼ punish: Heb. visit upon

footnotes.body_html: ▼ punish: Heb. visit upon

verses.text_plain: He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God:
verses.verse_html:
3He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God: ▼
▼ had…: Heb. was a prince, or, behaved himself princely

footnotes.body_text: ▼ had…: Heb. was a prince, or, behaved himself princely
footnotes.body_html: ▼ had…: Heb. was a prince, or, behaved himself princely

verses.text_plain: Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him in Beth–el, and there he spake with us;
verses.verse_html: 4Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him in Beth–el, and there he spake with us;

verses.text_plain: Even the Lord God of hosts; the Lord is his memorial.
verses.verse_html: 5Even the Lord God of hosts; the Lord is his memorial.

verses.text_plain: Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.
verses.verse_html: 6Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.

verses.text_plain: He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress.
verses.verse_html:
7He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress. ▼
▼ a merchant: or, Canaan
 , ▼
▼ oppress: or, deceive

footnotes.body_html: ▼ a merchant: or, Canaan

verses.text_plain: And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that were sin.
verses.verse_html:
8And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that were sin. ▼
▼ in all…: or, all my labours suffice me not: he shall have punishment of iniquity in whom is sin
 , ▼
▼ that: Heb. which

footnotes.body_text: ▼ in all…: or, all my labours suffice me not: he shall have punishment of iniquity in whom is sin
footnotes.body_html: ▼ in all…: or, all my labours suffice me not: he shall have punishment of iniquity in whom is sin

verses.text_plain: And I that am the Lord thy God from the land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.
verses.verse_html: 9And I that am the Lord thy God from the land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.

tokens.text: will yet make thee to dwell

verses.text_plain: I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets.
verses.verse_html:
10I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets. ▼
▼ ministry: Heb. hand

verses.text_plain: Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
verses.verse_html: 11Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.
verses.verse_html: 12And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.

verses.text_plain: And by a prophet the Lord brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.
verses.verse_html: 13And by a prophet the Lord brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.

verses.text_plain: Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.
verses.verse_html:
14Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him. ▼
▼ most…: Heb. with bitternesses
 , ▼
▼ blood: Heb. bloods

footnotes.body_html: ▼ most…: Heb. with bitternesses
